Part 4 you will hear a student on a fashion design course giving a talk about the history of pockets. First, you have some time to look at questions 31 to 40. Now listen carefully, carefully and answer questions. Questions 31 to 40. Now listen carefully, carefully and answer questions. Questions 31 to 40.
conversation.output: Good morning. Now, we've been asked to choose an aspect of European clothing or fashion and to talk about its development over time. I decided to focus on a rather small area of clothing, and that's pockets. I chose pockets for two reasons, really, you all have them in jeans, jackets, coats, for example, and even though we often carry bags or briefcases as well, nothing is quite as convenient as being able to pop your phone or credit card into your pocket yet. I suspect that other than that, people don't really think about pockets too much and they're rather overlooked as a fashion item. It's certainly very interesting to go back in time and see how pockets developed for men and women. In the 18th century. Fashions were quite different from the way they are now, and pockets were too. If we think about male fashion first, that was the time when suits became popular. Trousers were knee length only and referred to as breeches. The waistcoats were short and the jackets were long, but all three garments were lined with material and pockets were sewn into this cloth by whichever Taylor the customer used. The wearer could then carry small objects, such as pencils or coins on their person and reach them through a gap in the lining. Coat pockets became increasingly decorative on the outside for men who wanted to look stylish, but they were often larger but plainer if the wearer was someone with a profession who needed to carry medical instruments, a doctor or physician, for example. The development of women's pockets was a little different. For one thing, they weren't nearly as visible or as easy to reach as men's. In the 18th and 19th centuries, women carried numerous possessions on their person, and some of these could be worth a lot of money. Women were more vulnerable to theft, and wealthy women in particular worried constantly about pickpockets. So what they did was to have a pair of pockets made that were tied together with string. The pockets were made of fabric, which might be recycled cloth if the wearer had little money or something more expensive, such as linen, sometimes featuring very delicate embroidery. Women tied the pockets around their waist so that they hung beneath their clothes. Remember, skirts were long then, and there was plenty of room to hide a whole range of small possessions between the layers of petticoats that were commonly worn. They would have an opening in the folds of their skirts, through which they could reach whatever they needed, like their perfume. Working women. Women, of course, also needed to carry around items that they might use for whatever job or trade they were involved in, but their pairs of pockets still remained on the inside of their clothing. They just got bigger or longer, sometimes reaching down to their knees. So the tie on pockets went well into the 19th century and only changed when fashion altered towards the end of that period. That's when dresses became tighter and less bulky, and the pairs of pockets became very noticeable. They stood out too much and detracted from the woman's image. Women who had been used to carrying around a range of personal possessions and still wanted to needed somewhere to carry these items about their person. That was when small bags or pouches, as they were known, came into fashion. And of course, they inevitably led on to the handbag of more modern times, particularly when fashion removed pockets altogether.

conversation.input: That is the end of part 3. You now have 30 seconds to check your answers to part 3. Part 4 you will hear part of a lecture for astronomy students about the need for a system to manage satellites and other objects orbiting the Earth. First, you have some time to look at questions 31 to 40. Now listen carefully and answer questions. Questions 31 to 40. Now listen carefully and answer questions. Questions 31 to 40.
conversation.output: In today's astronomy lecture I'm going to talk about the need for a system to manage the movement of satellites and other objects in orbit around the Earth. In other words, a space traffic management system. We already have effective air traffic control systems that are used internationally to ensure that planes navigate our skies safely. Well, space traffic management is a similar concept, but focusing on the control of satellites. The aim of such a system would be to prevent the danger of collisions in space between the objects in orbit around the Earth. In order to do this, we'd need to have a set of legal measures, and we'd also have to develop the technical systems to enable us to prevent such accidents. But unfortunately, at present, we don't actually have a space traffic management system that works, so why not? What are the problems in developing such a system? Well, for one thing, satellites are relatively cheap these days compared with how they were in the past, meaning that more people can afford to put them into space, so there's a lot more of them out there. And people aren't just launching single satellites, but whole constellations consisting of thousands of them designed to work together. So space is getting more crowded every day. But in spite of this one thing you may be surprised to learn is that you can launch a satellite into space, and once it's out there, it doesn't have to send back any information to Earth to allow its identification. So while we have international systems for ensuring we know where the planes in our skies are and to prevent them from colliding with one another when it comes to the safety of satellites, at present we don't have anything like enough proper ways of tracking them. And it isn't just entire satellites that we need to consider. A greater threat is the huge amount of space debris in orbit around the Earth, broken bits of satellite and junk from space stations and so on. And some of these are so small that they can be very hard to identify, but they can still be very dangerous. In addition, some operators may be unwilling to share information about the satellites they've launched. For example, a satellite may be designed for military purposes, or it may have been launched for commercial reasons. And the operators don't want competitors to have information about it. And even if the operators are willing to provide it, the information isn't easy to collect. Details are needed about the object itself, as well as about its location at a particular time. And remember that a satellite isn't very big, and it's likely to be moving at thousands of kilometers an hour. We don't have any sensors that can constantly follow something moving so fast. So all that the scientists can do is to put forward a prediction concerning where the satellite is heading there next. So those are some of the problems that we're facing. Let's consider now some of the solutions that have been suggested. One key issue is the way in which information is dealt with. We need more information, but it also needs to be accessible at a global level, so we need to establish shared standards that we can all agree on for the way in which this information is presented. We already do this in other areas of science. So although this is a challenge, it's not an impossible task. Then as all this information's collected, it needs to be put together so it can be used, and that will involve creating a single database on which it can be entered As we continue to push forward new developments, congestion of the space environment is only going to increase. To cope with this, we need to develop a system like the one I've described to coordinate the work of the numerous spacecraft operators. But it's also essential that this system is one that establishes trust in the people that use it both nationally and at a global level. One interesting development that I'll mention at this.

conversation.input: That is the end of part 1. You now have one minute to check your answers to part 1. Part 2 you will hear a guide at a farming museum talking to a group of visitors. conversation.output: Good morning, everyone, and welcome to the Museum of Farming Life. I understand it's your first visit here, so I'd like to give you some background information about the museum and then explain a little about what you can see during your visit. So where we're standing at the moment is the entrance to a large building that was constructed in 1880 as the home of a local businessman, Alfred Palmer of the Palmer Biscuit Factory. It was later sold and became a hall of residence for students in 1911 and a museum in 1951. In 2005, a modern extension was built to accommodate the museum's collections, the museums owned by the university and apart from two rooms that are our offices, the university uses the main part of the building. You may see students going into the building for lessons, but it's not open to museum visitors. I'm afraid it's a shame because the interior architectural features are outstanding, especially the room that used to be the library. Luckily, we've managed to keep entry to the museum free. This includes access to all the galleries, outdoor areas and the rooms for special exhibitions. We run activities for children and students such as the Museum Club, for which there is no charge. We do have a donation box just over there, so feel free, free to give whatever amount you consider appropriate. We do have a cloakroom if you'd like to leave your coats and bag somewhere. Unlike other museums, photography is allowed here, so you might like to keep your cameras with you. You might be more comfortable not carrying around heavy rucksacks though. Keep your coats and jackets on as it's quite cold in the museum garden today.

conversation.input: Before you hear the rest of the talk, you have some time to look at questions 15 to 20. Now listen and answer questions. Questions 15 to 20. Now listen and answer questions. Questions 15 to 20.
conversation.output: I'd like to tell you about the different areas of the museum just inside and outside the main gallery, we have an area called Four Seasons. Here you can watch a 4 minute animation of a woodland scene. It was designed especially for the museum by a group of young people on a film studies course and it's beautiful. Children absolutely love it, but then so do adults. The main galleries called Town and Country. It includes a photographic collection of prize winning sheep and shepherds leaving town and country. You enter Farmhouse Kitchen, which is well, self explanatory. Here we have the oldest collection of equipment for making butter and cheese in the country and this morning a specialist cheesemaker will be giving demonstrations of how it's produced. He may even get to try some. After that. You can go in two directions. To the right is a staircase that takes you up to a landing from where you can look down on the galleries. To the left is a room called a year on the farm. There is lots of seating here as sometimes we use the room for school visits, so it's a good place to stop for a rest. If you're feeling competitive, you can take our memory test in which you answer questions about things you've seen in the museum. The next area is called Wagon Walk. This contains farm carts from nearly every part of the country. It's surprising how much regional variation there was. Beside the carts are display boards with information about each one. The carts are old and fragile, so we ask you to keep your children close to you and ensure they don't climb on the carts. From Wagon Walk, you can either make your way back to reception or go out into the garden, or even go back to take another look in the galleries. In the far corner of the garden is Bees are Magic, but we're redeveloping this area, so you can't visit that at the moment. You can still buy our honey in the shop though. Finally, there is the pond which contains all kinds of interesting wildlife. There are baby ducks that are only a few days old as well as tiny frogs. The pond isn't deep and there is a fence around it, so it's perfectly safe for children.

conversation.output: The person I've chosen to talk about is the French writer Victor Hugo. Many people have heard of him because his novel lay miserable, which he wrote in 18 sixtytwo is famous around the world. It became a stage musical in the 1980s, and a film version was also released in 2012. So some of us I'm sure have a pretty general idea of the plot, but we know much less about the author. Today I'm going to provide a little more insight into this talented man, and I'm going to talk particularly about the home he had on the island of gurnnsey in the British Channel Islands. But first, his early career. As I've said, he was a writer. He was at the height of his career in Paris, and he was very highly regarded by his colleagues. As far as literature was concerned, he was the leading figure of the romantic movement. However, as well as being a literary genius, he also gave many speeches about issues like the level of poverty in his society. He felt very strongly about this and about other areas where change was needed, like education. This kind of outspoken criticism was not well liked by the rulers of France, and eventually the Emperor Napoleon the third told Victor Hugo to leave Paris and not return. In other words, he sent him into exile. So Victor Hugo was forced to reside in other parts of Europe. Guernsey was actually his third place of exile, and he landed there in 1855. He produced a lot while on gurnsey, including lame, miserable, and to do this he had to spend a great deal of time in the home that he had there. This was a property that he bought using the money he'd made in France from the publication of a collection of his poetry. It was the only property he ever owned, and he was very proud of it. The property Victor Hugo bought on Guernsey was a large five story house in the capital town of Saint Peter Port, and he lived there for 15 years, returning to France in 1870 when Napoleon's empire collapsed. He decorated and furnished each level or floor of the house in unique and wonderful ways, and many people consider the inside of the house to be a work of art. Today, it's a museum that attracts 200000 visitors a year. He lived in the house with his family, and portraits of its members still hang in rooms on the ground floor, along with drawings that he did during his travels that he felt were important to him. In other ground floor rooms, there are huge tapestries that he would have designed and loved. The walls are covered in dark wood paneling that Victor Hugo created himself using wooden furniture that he bought in the market. The items were relatively inexpensive, and he used them to create intricate carvings. They gave an atmosphere on the lower level that was shadowy and rather solemn. On the next level of the house, there are two impressive lounges where he entertained his guests. One lounge has entirely red furnishings such as sofas and wall coverings, and the other blue. There's a strong Chinese influence in these areas in things like the wallpaper pattern and the lamps, which he would have made himself by copying original versions. His library, where he left many of his favourite books, forms the hallway to the third floor and was a comfortable area where he could relax and enjoy his afternoons. And then at the very top of the house, there's a room called the Lookout. Call that because it looks out over the harbour, in contrast to the rather dark lower levels, it's full of light and was like a glass office where he would write until lunchtime, often at his desk. So Victor Hugo was a man of many talents, but he was also true to his values. While living in his house on Guernsey, he entertained many other famous writers, but he also invited a large group of local children from the deprived areas of the island to dinner once a week. What's more, he served them their food, which was an extraordinary gesture for the time period. In 1927. The house was owned by his relatives and they decided to donate it to the city of Paris. It has since been restored using photographs from the period and as I mentioned earlier, is now a museum that is open to the public.

conversation.input: Okay, so let's start off by talking about your work. Do you work or do you study well?
conversation.output: I'm currently working. I finisheded my studies two years ago, so I'm currently working as a pharmacist .

conversation.input: and where do you currently work?
conversation.output: I currently work in Dublin, I came in Dublin a few months ago, I worked previous in Romania from where I am.

conversation.input: And why did you choose that career?
conversation.output: Well, I think my mother has some influences on me, so she's, she's an assistant and she always taught that pharmacy will suit me and it's a easy job and a respected job, so she kind of pushed me to do pharmacy, so I chose pharmacy Indian.

conversation.input: and do you enjoy your job?
conversation.output: I do now, like when I was in Romania, I didn't like it that much, but now in Ireland, the system is different and I feel more appreciated for my work. So, it starts to groan me.

conversation.input: good. So now let's talk about your hometown. Okay, so where are you from.
conversation.output: I am from a small town in Romania, so I grew up in a really small town. And then I moved, to a larger city near to my town and it's called negrest, so it's difficult for foreigners to pronounce it.

conversation.input: And do you like your home time?
conversation.output: I didn't like it when I was a child, I like it now because it's a small town, a small community where you can raise your children with no problems, with no bad influences. So it's a good place where you can grow up, and be a decent person.

conversation.input: Good, how often do you visit your hometown?
conversation.output: Now that I'm living in Ireland, probably I will visit it will, I will visit once or twice a year. But when I lived in the other city in, I went to negresh to Thu maybe twice a month.

conversation.input: And how do you think your hometown could be improved?
conversation.output: Well, because it's a small community, maybe just improve, the job offers, try to raise the local economy, Most of the people that are living there are farmers or they are working in constructions. So maybe just improve that part of and they can live better.

conversation.input: Now let's talk about your childhood. Did you have a nice childhood?

conversation.input: Let's talk about making money. Why do many people invest a lot of effort to make more and more money?
conversation.output: I think that people nowadays are more materialistic and they desire to make a lot of money so that they can buy luxury items like big house or a fancy car or maybe a lot of clothes. Honestly, I wouldn't mind myself having, these things.

conversation.input: Is this always good?
conversation.output: I think it is for most of the part because they can, they can have more money and they can lead a luxurious life. And it is actually depends on the way people think.

conversation.input: How have money making opportunities changed from one generation before?
conversation.output: That's a tricky question. I think during my parents time, people used to invest more in land and, businesses, but nowadays people are more into, investing in new investment types like, cryptocurrencies and making money online.

conversation.input: What new opportunities may be available in the future to make more money?
conversation.output: I suppose there will be people who are really interested to invest and control resources like fresh water or air because the human population is increasing and the resources are decreasing.

conversation.input: Some people feel that it is important to save as much money as possible. Is this good idea?
conversation.output: I think saving money is a good idea because it helps people to lead a successful life. But in order to make the economy flowing, money needs to be spent. So I think it's better if someone tries to spend enough money as well as save enough money.

conversation.input: Let's talk about financial freedom. What does it mean to have financial freedom?
conversation.output: Having financial freedom means a person, doesn't have to worry about making money for sustenance needs like food, shelter, or clothing. And they don't have to work every day in order to meet these needs. And they can have enough money to last in a lifetime.

conversation.input: What are ways that people achieve financial freedom?
conversation.output: I think there are so many ways in order to achieve financial freedom, like they can have a successful business, just like the idea that I've mentioned before, starting the online fashion competition, or just simply being lucky or winning a lot of money.

conversation.input: If a person has reached financial freedom, what is a good way to invest their time afterwards?
conversation.output: I hope that one day I'll be in a position to really have to concern myself about that. But jocks aside, I personally think that people need to invest their money once, like their time once they are no longer concerned about anything financially, they can actually do something like philanthropy, helping people and nature, also maybe starting a charity to empower people to lead a healthy life.

conversation.input: Let's talk about charities. Many people give lots of money to charities. Is this always good.

conversation.output: My favorite sport is swimming. I usually swim when it's warm outside, and in colder months I prefer to go to the local pool.

conversation.output: well, I think that trendy and comfortable are not mutually exclusive things, and I think that comfortable shoes can also look good. You can walk, the whole day looking good and having no discomfort.

conversation.output: I am like it to have an average women's shoe size. My size is 6 and I don't have any difficulties to find a shoe size.

conversation.output: I usually wear clogs and loafers and this allows me to be elegant and comfortable at the same time. I wear this shoes from 5 to six times a week and in colder months I prefer to wear boots and these boots will keep my feet warm and look good.

conversation.input: Do you spend a lot on shoes?
conversation.output: I have to admit that I do, I can spend an average of 1000 greenness a month on shoes easily, but I just recently got a new pair of shoes that cost me around thirtyfive hundred green.

conversation.input: Have the kind of shoes you wear daily changed over the past 10 years?
conversation.output: I think so, yes, since I have grown into adulthood over the past decade and I work now, my shoes became more expensive and they look nice. I used to wear sneakers more often when I was, studying at the university.

conversation.input: If you could buy any pair of shoes in the world, what would they be?
conversation.output: Given a chance? I would love to get a white kitten heel shoes. They are not only looking good but also pretty unique. I would love to have a pair, but they can be really hard to come by.

conversation.input: okay, jalio for part 1, I will ask you a couple of questions to get to know you better and some questions on a general topic. Where do you live?
conversation.output: I live in, here in India in a three bedroom house, in Isabel herbs of calgetta I've lived here all my life.

conversation.input: What do you do in your free time?
conversation.output: In my spare time, I like to watch a good flick or go out with some of my friends. Just yesterday I did both. I went out with two of my friends to the theater and we had, it's a great time.

conversation.input: Let's talk about parents, how often do you see your parents?
conversation.output: Fortunately, I see my parents every day because as I had mentioned earlier I'm living at home. I saw both my mom and dad this morning before coming to this exam.

conversation.input: Where do your parents live?
conversation.output: They reside in the same house as me, just on the outskirts of culture, my mom and dad, bought our home, just before my older brother was born, back at the end of the 90s.

conversation.input: What do you like about your mom and dad?
conversation.output: I think my mom and dad are great. Specifically, they are very supportive of my decisions and they love me very much. Both my mom and dad take their time to resolve challenges that come up in my life. Most recently, my decision to study abroad and the best way to go about this.

conversation.input: Why is it important to have good parents?
conversation.output: Having good parents, in my opinion, is the key to have a happy, healthy and successful life. I mean, parents are the foundation for the ideologies and behaviors that a person develops to navigate their life. Good parents like mine empower their children to be, confident and ambitious.

conversation.input: How has parenting change from one generation before?
conversation.output: That's tough to say. I think that, parenting has evolved from a generation ago, especially in the sense of, respect, that's given by parents to their children friend. I think during my grandparents time, children were loved, but they're treated as less equal to adults. And parents these days have a greater sense of respect for the emotion, questions and perspectives of their children. And this has been a positive change.

conversation.input: If you could change your parents in some way.
conversation.output: what would it be? Honestly, I don't think, I would change any part of my parents as I love them just the way they are. However, if I could, I would wave my magic wand so that they can have even more financial security and never have to worry about money .

conversation.output: About a year ago, I had a chance to briefly meet with anaica Canna, who is one of the most well known fashion designers in India, and I remember being super nervous as she has been, one of my idols and inspirations, since my teenage years. Miss Kana is a beautiful and hardworking fashion designer who's well known for blending traditional Indian textile with western silhouettes. Her designs are just stunning. I had a chance to meet with her during the culture week in New Delhi, in the year of 2016, she has been showcased in Paris Fashion week and it's fair to say that her designs are recognized not just in India, but also worldwide. And the culture week that I mentioned before, it was a fashion event that I had attended as a teenager and it was life changing for me. I was austacked by all the beauty, creativity, and glamour of the event and I knew that I wanted to be a part of it. After the fashion shows, there was a chance for the public to meet with some of the celebrity designers, including Miss Kenner, who was by that time an idol. For me. I had always wondered, what had inspired her to become a fashion designer, and even more importantly, where she draws her creative inspiration for her amazing productions. I remember having butterflies in my stomach when I finally got a chance to, speak with her. And I felt like I wouldn't be able to make a sound. She was, very pleasant and made me feel comfortable. I asked her my questions and she kindly replied, this was definitely one of the most nerve racking interactions I've ever had. And, it was also exhilarating.

conversation.output: No, I haven't, but hopefully I would like to meet her someday, when I become a fashion designer.

conversation.input: Let's talk about first impressions. What should a person pay attention to when meeting an important individual, like a teacher or a boss for the first time?
conversation.output: I think that it's, important to be polite and make eye contact when first introducing to a teacher or Brandon toir .

conversation.input: why is this?
conversation.output: I think that the person should, feel honesty and respect from the individual so that, it sets the foundation for a positive relationship going forward. I really pay attention to this myself.

conversation.input: How well can a person evaluate someone based on the first time meeting?
conversation.output: That's tough to say. Honestly, I don't think a person can truly gauge another's character, just based on their first time interaction, Although first impressions do give some important information. People are very complex and have different moods on different days. So it's not fair to judge a person, on one time conversation.

conversation.input: Is this always true?
conversation.output: I think it is most of the time because people do change and they are complicated emotionally .

conversation.input: in what ways has meeting people for the first time changed from years ago?
conversation.output: I think that, technology has had a bigger impact on people's first bookups, these past three decades. Nowadays people will often meet online, before they meet in person through, social apps like Tinder or Instagram.

conversation.input: How has this impacted relationships?
conversation.output: I think mostly meeting virtually for the first time, affects people's expectations since it's hard to know how much of that person is genuine. A lot of people fake their profiles and even their pictures to cast an unrealistic image of themselves to others.

conversation.input: Let's talk about networking with people. What are the benefits of building relationships with people in the community?
conversation.output: Getting to know people in the neighborhood is advantageous for building a sense of security and belonging in case of emergencies. It's very beneficial to be able to rely on people close by for help. My family is quite tight with, people living around us and this has been very helpful in many cases. Like the other day, when my neighbor helped my dad to jump status car.

conversation.input: are there any negatives?
conversation.output: I think sometimes neighbors can be nosy or judgmental, and this can be drawbacks of living in a tight community. But this is less important than the benefits I mentioned.

conversation.input: How has technology impacted the way people network?
conversation.output: Just as I mentioned previously, technology has had a major impact on the way people build and establish, their social groups, specifically through communication channels that didn't even exist before the advent of the internet.

conversation.input: Is this a good development?
conversation.output: I think this is positive for most part as it gives additional tools, for staying in touch, that didn't even exist before. The one downside maybe, that people don't get, to meet people in a face to face .

conversation.output: thank you, have a great day .

conversation.output: My whole name is tanby neither as it is in my passport. Please just call me by my first name tanby .

conversation.output: I live in Tamil Nadu, the most southeastern state of India in its capital Chennai, in a two bedroom flat with my parents.

conversation.input: What do you do to relax?
conversation.output: There are several activities I like to do to unwind, including swimming, running or watching a film. I have really been into nature documentaries these days.

conversation.input: Let's talk about traveling. How often do you go on a trip?
conversation.output: I think domestically, I mean around India, I go traveling at least two to three times a year and my parents and I usually take a trip abroad once a year. Last year we visited Bangladesh.

conversation.input: One was the last time you went on a trip?
conversation.output: Just the last month I went on a five day holiday to the neighboring state of where I visited some friends and we, I really had a good time hanging out and going to the beach.

conversation.input: What was your favorite holiday?
conversation.output: That's tough to say because I have had few amazing trips during the last years wherein, my family and I, took a trip to Australia. It was a two week vacation wherein I got to see amazing animals like kangaroos and Koala Bess. So I think that one ranks at the top of my leash for now.

conversation.input: How has traveling changed during the last years?
conversation.output: There have been drastic changes to travel and tourism over the couple of decades, mostly because of the recent pandemic. Many countries had to close their borders, so travelers become much more restricted and difficult. Some hotels have great deals right now and they are trying to get more customers.

conversation.input: If you could go on a trip anywhere in the world, where would you go?
conversation.output: I have thought a fair bit about this recently for the reasons I mentioned earlier that I haven't traveled much. So if I could go anywhere, I would love to travel the east coast of the us all the way from New York down to Miami. I have seen a lot, a lot of these cities in the movie. So it would just be amazing to check them out in real life.

conversation.output: I surprised my mom on a most recent birthday with a pretty silver Bengal bracelet. I had been planning to get a nice gift as this was a 50th birthday and I wanted how to feel very special, so I saved up a bit of money from work and did a quite a bit of searching both online and in a local store for just the right bracelet. I know that my mom had been window shopping for this kind of an accessory for a while. After some searching, I just found the right silver Bengal at a local jewellers called Twilight. This is a fine jewelry weighing 50 g with a two tone polish, wave pattern and two elephant heads interlocking each other. The elephant symbolizes the removal of obstacles to bring good fortune, and I definitely want my mom to have a comfortable life full of good luck. I've got the jewelry and I asked the jeweller to put the silver bra bracelet in a nice box and I gift trapped it in a pretty pink paper with a red bow. I, included a birthday card as well, letting her know how grateful I am to be a daughter. I gave this to her last October at her birthday party wherein my family hosted at our home. I gave it to her and she wears it every day and this makes me feel so happy. I gave this to her for my heart and I do not expect a gift in return. However, knowing my mom I'm pretty sure she will get me a nice gift for my birthday as well.

For this part, I will ask you some questions, connected to the topic of part 2, Let's talk about giving presence. Do you think parents give too many gifts nowadays?
conversation.output: I think that, many parents do buy too many gifts for their children. I mean, kids get showered with so many toys these days that they don't even play with many of them or they play with them maybe once or twice before they end up at the bottom of a box.

conversation.input: Why might this be negative?
conversation.output: This can be negative because kids can develop a lack of appreciation towards their belongings and they will consume and destroy more that would damage nature, not to mention it's expensive.

conversation.input: Is gift giving important for the economy of a country?
conversation.output: I think that buying gifts stimulates the financial flow in a country. I mean, billions of dollars are spent each year on our gifts or maybe, or it can be a celebrations or various occasions or Valentine's Day to name a few.

conversation.input: How does giving gifts affect the environment?
conversation.output: Nature unfortunately suffers from much of this gift giving culture, not only because of overconsumption, but also because of the packaging used for gifts and the wrapping papers.

conversation.input: Why is it sometimes difficult to buy a gift for someone?
conversation.output: Some people are hard to figure out. I mean, it's tricky, especially when people have so many belongings. One of my cousin is really wealthy and he has about everything that a person can imagine and it's really difficult to get him to find him a nice gift .

conversation.input: what are good ways to overcome such challenges?
conversation.output: I think, getting to know the person better and also, figuring out what the person might be into would be a good start.

conversation.input: What are some practical gifts to buy for others?
conversation.output: Giving some instruments or tools is usually quite practical. I mean, the last time on my mom's birthday, I got her a soda maker, which was quite useful for making refreshing beverages for the family.

conversation.input: When is it a good idea to buy a person a practical gift?
conversation.output: If a person is short on cash or is missing out on some essential items, then that is a good idea to give them a practical gift. Buying some clothing for a person in need is a good example of this.

conversation.input: How have the practices of gift giving changed compared to a generation prior?
conversation.output: Let me think. Giving gift cards or cash has become much more popular, but in the past people had much more time and they used to go out and make gifts or else they had much more time to look around for giving much more meaningful gifts to people.

conversation.input: Is this good or bad?
conversation.output: I'm not sure. I think it would be nice if people had much more time buying a meaningful gift, but I wouldn't say that gift cards or cash would be bad by any means.

conversation.input: Which kinds of presents have become popular over the last decade that wasn't such a fat in the past.
conversation.output: I think electronic gift cards like Amazon, Google, Google and Apple are trend Wendy these days and digital devices like smartphones and smart watches are way more popular now than in the past because they weren't available couple of decades ago.

conversation.input: Why is this?
conversation.output: Well, because people have switched to online shopping and it's much more convenient.

conversation.output: okay, goodbye, thank you.

conversation.input: Let's talk about newspaper and magazine, How often do you read a newspaper? How about a magazine?

conversation.input: When is the last time, you bought a magazine or newspaper?

conversation.input: Have you ever written an article for a magazine or newspaper?

conversation.output: I had a truly lovely, dining experience at under the Mango Tree Restaurant, which is located in the west part of Bhopal, not too far from the national Park and Lake. I had been there with my parents and one of my close friends, we really didn't have any chance to go out and enjoy a restaurant due to the pandemic lockdown. And my dad splurged a bit and took us for a fine dining restaurant. I did a bit of research online for under the mango tree and found the reviews to be great. 4.5, out of 5 and the ambience is truly amazing. The restaurant is located inside the palace and there are sitting on the rooftop overlooking the pool. There are lanterns all around and it is a open air and we literally sit around a big beautiful mango tree. This is a barbecue restaurant and they sold us dishes which are served to the royal families over the centuries, an opportunity to taste variety of dishes like curries and kebabs, as well as some rice dishes and delicious lussy. So much of the experience was outstanding. The service, the food, the ambience, it was splendid. It is really hard to say how under the mango tree, could be even better with all the services they provide, but I suppose the service could be faster. Personally, I think there is no rush for a person when he's sitting under such a beautiful place. Of course it could be cheaper, but with the quality of service they provide, they couldn't do it any cheaper. In all, I feel it is a perfect experience.

conversation.input: Alright I'll stop you there, your time is up and please turn over your note paper and put it to the side along with your pencil. I'll take back the questions and now we will continue with part 3. For this part I will ask you some questions related to your response, and connected to this topic. Let's talk about successful restaurants, what are the most popular types of restaurants these days?
conversation.output: It is sad to say but the most popular restaurants these days are the fast food chains like McDonald's and kfcs, because they, provide fast food and at a cheaper cost. And also they are addictive because of all the M SG and sugar. However, I must say that restaurants like under the mango tree are also popular for their quality.

conversation.input: And why are these so popular?
conversation.output: As I mentioned before, these places, provide fast food and cheap food and people nowadays are busy in their life and they don't have much money. So they prefer, fast food. And especially a lot of young people go out to these outlets for a quick bite.

conversation.input: What is needed for a restaurant to be successful.
conversation.output: for a restaurant to be successful? I believe like under the mango tree, the quality of food is firstly important. Apart from that, the service is important and it should have a unique selling point like a beautiful view.

conversation.input: How do negative experiences affect the restaurant?
conversation.output: Oh, bad experience at a restaurant is your way to go out of business. I have heard an average customer will tell at least five people when they have a good experience eating out and but they will tell at least 12 people when they have a very bad experience eating out. The customer is always right. Policy is very important in a hospitality industry.

conversation.input: How has technology affected the success or failure of a restaurant?
conversation.output: The modern technologies are used for preparing food, ordering and serving has a very much helped in restaurants to be successful. So many restaurants nowadays use digital menus. They have a QR code at the table to order food. Also reviews online can make or break a restaurant. As I mentioned earlier, the reason I chose to go to Under the Mango Tree was because of the online reviews. It had .5 from almost 400. Guess .

conversation.input: let's talk about improving business. What are the best ways to improve the operations of a business?
conversation.output: I think the right way to optimize a business is through regular reviews and feedback of activities and the results, as this can help the company identify the mistakes and make improvements. Therefore, customer feedback is very important.

conversation.input: Who is responsible for improving a business?
conversation.output: It is the owner, the management and the frontline workers who is responsible for a business to provide quality products and services. Problems in any tier in staffing can result in a negative impact.

conversation.input: What resources are available to help businesses to operate well?
conversation.output: I think there are many resources available for companies to function, especially in capitalist society, where small and medium businesses are the backbone of the economy. There are different kinds of business loans, trainings, and tax benefits available for, companies to try during the pandemic. The government provided relief funds for companies to survive the hardship.

conversation.input: How can entrepreneurs find resources to improve their business?
conversation.output: The best way to support startup or growing companies is to search online or network with others in the industry. It is wise to get more information from experienced companies that have already gone through growing pains.

conversation.output: thank you, bye.

I had been there with my parents and one of my close friends, we really didn't have any chance to go out and enjoy a restaurant due to the pandemic lockdown. And my dad splurged a bit and took us for a fine dining restaurant. I did a bit of research online for under the mango tree and found the reviews to be great. 4.5, out of 5 and the ambience is truly amazing. The restaurant is located inside the palace and there are sitting on the rooftop overlooking the pool. There are lanterns all around and it is a open air and we literally sit around a big beautiful mango tree. This is a barbecue restaurant and they sold us dishes which are served to the royal families over the centuries, an opportunity to taste variety of dishes like curries and kebabs, as well as some rice dishes and delicious lussy. So much of the experience was outstanding. The service, the food, the ambience, it was splendid. It is really hard to say how under the mango tree, could be even better with all the services they provide, but I suppose the service could be faster. Personally, I think there is no rush for a person when he's sitting under such a beautiful place. Of course it could be cheaper, but with the quality of service they provide, they couldn't do it any cheaper. In all, I feel it is a perfect experience.

conversation.input: Alright I'll stop you there, your time is up and please turn over your note paper and put it to the side along with your pencil. I'll take back the questions and now we will continue with part 3. For this part I will ask you some questions related to your response, and connected to this topic. Let's talk about successful restaurants, what are the most popular types of restaurants these days?
conversation.output: It is sad to say but the most popular restaurants these days are the fast food chains like McDonald's and kfcs, because they, provide fast food and at a cheaper cost. And also they are addictive because of all the M SG and sugar. However, I must say that restaurants like under the mango tree are also popular for their quality.

conversation.input: And why are these so popular?
conversation.output: As I mentioned before, these places, provide fast food and cheap food and people nowadays are busy in their life and they don't have much money. So they prefer, fast food. And especially a lot of young people go out to these outlets for a quick bite.

conversation.input: What is needed for a restaurant to be successful.
conversation.output: for a restaurant to be successful? I believe like under the mango tree, the quality of food is firstly important. Apart from that, the service is important and it should have a unique selling point like a beautiful view.

conversation.input: How do negative experiences affect the restaurant?
conversation.output: Oh, bad experience at a restaurant is your way to go out of business. I have heard an average customer will tell at least five people when they have a good experience eating out and but they will tell at least 12 people when they have a very bad experience eating out. The customer is always right. Policy is very important in a hospitality industry.

conversation.input: How has technology affected the success or failure of a restaurant?
conversation.output: The modern technologies are used for preparing food, ordering and serving has a very much helped in restaurants to be successful. So many restaurants nowadays use digital menus. They have a QR code at the table to order food. Also reviews online can make or break a restaurant. As I mentioned earlier, the reason I chose to go to Under the Mango Tree was because of the online reviews. It had .5 from almost 400. Guess .

conversation.input: let's talk about improving business. What are the best ways to improve the operations of a business?
conversation.output: I think the right way to optimize a business is through regular reviews and feedback of activities and the results, as this can help the company identify the mistakes and make improvements. Therefore, customer feedback is very important.

conversation.input: Who is responsible for improving a business?
conversation.output: It is the owner, the management and the frontline workers who is responsible for a business to provide quality products and services. Problems in any tier in staffing can result in a negative impact.

conversation.input: What resources are available to help businesses to operate well?
conversation.output: I think there are many resources available for companies to function, especially in capitalist society, where small and medium businesses are the backbone of the economy. There are different kinds of business loans, trainings, and tax benefits available for, companies to try during the pandemic. The government provided relief funds for companies to survive the hardship.

conversation.input: How can entrepreneurs find resources to improve their business?
conversation.output: The best way to support startup or growing companies is to search online or network with others in the industry. It is wise to get more information from experienced companies that have already gone through growing pains.

conversation.input: That is the end of part 3 that concludes the speaking section of the IELTS exam. You will have your mark available online in about two days and your official certificate in the mail in about 10 days time. Goodbye.
conversation.output: thank you, bye.

Her speaking isn't flawless, it means that she does make some mistakes, but they are far and few between. So what is required to be graded? An expert user on the IELTS exam? Let's take a look at part 3 in part 3, as with part 1, tarana continues a conversation style communication with the information is connected when asked about popular restaurants, she answers fast food places with examples like KFC and McDonald's, but that she also reflects back to part 2, saying that fine dining restaurants like under the manual tree are also popular. Now let's begin. Welcome to the speaking portion of the IELTS exam. My name is Adrian, I will be your examiner for this part of the test, this is candidate number 9, 5 8 1 7 6 6 2 and this is examiner number 1 7 5 8 2. We are currently conducting this exam in Mumbai. The time right now is 14 o'clock and I am recording this for, marking and clerical purposes. May I see your passport please? Now let's begin. Welcome to the speaking portion of the IELTS exam. My name is Adrian, I will be your examiner for this part of the test, this is candidate number 9, 5 8 1 7 6 6 2 and this is examiner number 1 7 5 8 2. We are currently conducting this exam in Mumbai. The time right now is 14 o'clock and I am recording this for, marking and clerical purposes. May I see your passport please?
conversation.output: Yes, certainly here is my passport please take a look .

conversation.input: What is your full name .
conversation.output: My first name is riage and my family name is Burma. Please refer to me by my first name riaj.

conversation.input: okay? For part 1, I will ask you a couple of questions to get to me better and some questions on a general topic. Do you work or go to school?
conversation.output: I was doing some vocational study recently here in Mumbai, but right now i'm working as a salesperson in a clothing store.

conversation.input: What do you like about your workplace or school?
conversation.output: I really like my job because I get to meet a lot of interesting people and I help them the right products. Like the other day I met an actress and it was quite exciting.

conversation.input: Let's talk about daily routines. What is the first thing you do after you wake up?
conversation.output: As soon as I wake up, my first act is to brush my teeth. I really don't like the taste of my morning breath, so I head straight for the bathroom. After that, I get dressed and have my breakfast.

conversation.input: Where do you usually go for lunch?
conversation.output: Usually I have my lunch with my colleagues at work. We do have a staff room at the back of our store where I sit at a small table and enjoy my own time meal.

conversation.input: Who are people that you meet with each week?
conversation.output: As I mentioned earlier, I meet with lots of customers during the day. Apart from that, we have a weekly meeting with our boss and coworkers, and I meet my family and friends to hang out with them. Yesterday I went for tea with two of my close friends.

conversation.input: Why is it important to have some routines in life?
conversation.output: I think it's really important to have some daily routines like brushing my teeth and going to gym because it's important for health and development of a person. I go to work so I can save some money for my school and my living, and I think it helps me to grow as an individual.

conversation.input: How have your daily routines changed over the past five years?
conversation.output: My daily routines have evolved significantly over last half a decade. I used to go to school, but right now I'm working in the evening. I used to watch TV, but these days I prefer going up with my friends and family to hang out, So I think it has changed a lot.

conversation.input: If you could change one part of your daily routine, what would it be?
conversation.output: I think if I could do something differently, then definitely it's it will be the time I go to bed because I think I usually get to bed late at times, so I'm a bit tired the next day.

conversation.input: That is the end of part 1. We will now continue with part 2. For part 2, I will show you some questions. You will have one minute to read these questions, think about your answers, you have some note paper and your pencil there, so you can take notes in the one minute if you wish, and then you will have one to two minutes to speak. I will tell you when to start, when to stop. Please do not touch the paper with the questions. Talk about an idea that you had to make someone happy. Your one minute preparation time begins now. Rion, cheer, your one minute preparation time is up. Please begin speaking. Rion, cheer, your one minute preparation time is up. Please begin speaking.
conversation.output: Last year I had a brilliant idea to make my friend sagel happy because she was really down after losing her job. She called me on a Saturday night to tell me that she had been let go from her company because they were downsizing due to financial crisis. So basically she was sobbing on phone. So I really wanted to cheer her up. So after my conversation with her, I really wanted to do something special to put a smile on her face. So I decided to call up all my friends for a surprise night out. I discovered that there's a place called Mystery Rooms Mumbai where we can all play together to escape from a room. It's basically a place where we all play together to solve out a mystery, to get out of a room with all kinds, kinds of excitement and danger. So we chose the con theme that's kind of like a mission impossible story where we had to get away with a big diamond. So all that was needed to make this happen was to call up all my friends. And that was about thousand rupees per head for admission. And we got one of our friends got to get there. So anyhow, my three friends, including sagel, and I went there and really had a blast on a Friday night. We were like screaming there and laughing for like 3 or four hours. And the best thing is we were able to escape out of the room just in time and it was really great. So after everything, sagel was really happy, like I think she was really cheered up. She left on a positive vibe for the entire following week that helped her in getting a new job that was better than her previous job. So I think letting lose a bit and remembering that life is meant to be fun helped her in her success.

conversation.input: Your time is up. I'm going to stop you there, ranch. Please turn the note paper over and fit to the side along with the pencil. We're going to take back the questions and now we'll start with part 3. For this part, I will ask you a question related to your response and some questions on this topic. Would you recommend this activity to others as well? Yes.
conversation.output: I will definitely recommend this to people like 16 years or older. I have already recommended this to dozens of people and I think they really have a tons of fun.

conversation.input: Let's talk about creating positive experiences. What are some different ways that people can make others happy?
conversation.output: I think there are lots of way to put someone in a better mood. Like you can go for a night out, like with it, with our friends, saagel, or you can have a conversation over a warm cup of tea. I think the most important thing is to be a good listener and to be empathetic.

conversation.input: What is a simple way to make a person feel good?
conversation.output: I think the simplest way to make a person feel good is to give them a warm and sincere hug. It always works for me.

conversation.input: How has society improved over the past few hundred years to enable citizens to feel better?
conversation.output: I think there has been much in the way of improving the society, like in terms of medicine and technology, like cars and computers. Like we have evolved a lot. Like I think people these days on the most part, to have more positive experience than negative ones. I remember like when I sit with my grandmother, she had to face a lot more hardships than my parents or me.

conversation.input: What further improvements can society make to help citizens have even more positive experiences?
conversation.output: I think there are still so many things we can do better. Like people are expecting clean water and clean air for their safety. There are some places where people cannot go in the night because they feel it's dangerous for them.

conversation.input: Let's talk about sharing memories. Why is it important to share our memories with other people?
conversation.output: I think people really feel the need to share pictures and videos because they think it helps them to relive the experience. I show my pictures and videos to my friends because I feel like I'm doing the same thing with them again, like I show the pictures of escape room because it was a lot of fun.

conversation.input: Is it always good to share our past with others?
conversation.output: No, I don't think so, because we have to consider the other person's position too, because some pictures might bring up some bad memories for him or her, and some people may feel sad or jealous because they may not not have enough money to do expensive stuff like going to Hawaii, for instance.

conversation.input: What are some ways that people can share their positive experiences with other individuals?
conversation.output: I think the methods that are really popular these days are like communication apps like WhatsApp or Instagram. I think these are really easy and quick to use all a person needs is a mobile phone and an internet connection. I usually share my pictures and videos through these apps with my friends and family.

He takes notes, answers each of the questions on the card, has great structure, vocabulary, grammatic, medical range, and a lot of detail in his one to two minutes response. It is noteworthy to state that Ryan uses wonderful natural sounding expressions and vocabulary to paint a clear picture about how he helped to cheer up his friend Seagull by taking her to the mystery rooms in Mumbai instead of saying that she was fired from her job, he uses the more subtle expression of she was let go from her job. He explains that this happened because the company was downsizing again, a nice piece of vocabulary to indicate that the company was becoming smaller throughout his response, he uses some idiomatic language, like he helped put a smile on her face, meaning again, that he helped to cheer up his friend to make her happy. He explains to the examiner that the mystery room was kind of like a contheme or mission impossible style adventure where they had to steal a diamond and escape with it. These examples are smooth and he does not say, for example, or for instance, like when he gives the example of his grandmother, who has had to face many more hardships than people today, this makes his explanation very clear about how life has become easier and more positive for people nowadays than in the past. conversation.output: Well, since I'm really into makeup and beauty products, in my spare time, I enjoy sharing tips on these products. I even have an Instagram account where I regularly post videos.

conversation.input: How did you get to this exam today? Today .
conversation.output: I took the number 10 bus for eight stops and then I walked another 10 minutes to get here. It was quick and convenient and it gave me the chance to do a bit of last minute review of my notes.

conversation.input: Let's talk about languages. Why do people learn languages?
conversation.output: Well, the primary reason for people to study languages is to communicate with others. Within this, people require languages for work and studying and living in foreign countries. I've learned English so that I can do my higher education in the UK.

conversation.input: How often do you use English?
conversation.output: I was English on a daily basis. Whether I'm talking to my international friends or colleagues, using social media or watching some shows I'm constantly using using English.

conversation.input: Where do you use English frequently?
conversation.output: Definitely at my workplace. I work in marketing at an international firm and I have coworkers from all over the world, so the workplace language is English.

conversation.input: Who do you speak English to the most?
conversation.output: That would be my coworker and friend Amina. She's from Morocco and we work on many projects together. Also, we hang out outside of work and our common language is English.

conversation.input: How have learning language languages changed?
conversation.output: Studying languages has changed a lot in the past few decades because of considerable improvement in technology and rapid globalization. It has become much more possible to study from native speakers of language, both locally and through the internet. I've studied a lot of English with native tutors and using apps.

conversation.input: If you could learn another language, what would it be and why?
conversation.output: I would like to learn a bit of Arabic if I have a bit of time, not only because I could speak and practice with Amina, but it is also widely spoken around the world. So it would be very useful.

All right, Ryan Rhina, your one minute preparation time starts now. Go ahead. Ryan, Ryan, your one minute preparation time is up. Please begin speaking. Ryan, Ryan, your one minute preparation time is up. Please begin speaking.
conversation.output: A tool that is quite dangerous, which I have used before, is a chainsaw. This is a gas powered wood cutting tool that has a handle and a motor with a metal bar extending from it. And around the bar there is a chain with sharp teeth. The motor and handle have a plastic cover which is a bright orange color. The last time I had used the chainsaw was about 10 months ago when I was helping my uncle clean up around his property and get some firewood ready. Use the chain so to remove some dead branches from trees around property. And I also cut down a couple of smaller trees that were either dead or overcrowded. Chainsaw can be quite dangerous if it is not, maintained or rehandled. It is a very powerful cutting tool which can slice into a person's knee, leg or foot and cause a lot of damage to tissues and even bones. And also if the user cuts into hard material like metal or rock, or if the chain is worn out and not replaced, the saw can break and the pieces can come apart. Flying pieces of the chain or the material being cut like the pieces of wood or pebbles can damage the user's eyes and even blind them. So whenever a person is using a chainsaw, they must wear the correct safety equipment. The most important are nice pair of boots, preferably with steel toes, earmuffs to protect the ears from the loud sound of the engine, and safety glasses. There are special pants which can protect the legs from the chain and also a helmet is a good idea to protect the head in case of falling branches.

conversation.input: I will stop you there ryanna your time is up. Please put the, notes to the side as well as the card. Just turn it over and the pencil. And now we will continue with part 3. For part 3, I will ask a question related to your response and some questions connected to the topic of part 2. Who taught you how to use a chainsaw?
conversation.output: Oh, my uncle noticed lamb taught me the way to use it. About five years ago, he saw that I was quite interested in it when we were visiting with my dad and he showed me what to do with it and what to be careful about.

conversation.input: Let's talk about dangerous objects. What are some common objects around the home which can be dangerous when used incorrectly?
conversation.output: There are quite a few household items that can be hazardous to health if not used well immediately. A blender, a kitchen knife and a hairdryer come to mind. These items can either cut, burn or electrocute the user. I know I've got myself with a knife a few times in the best.

conversation.input: Which of these most often leads to injuries?
conversation.output: I would say that the kitchen knife is probably the one that most commonly injures people just because it is frequently used. I mean, there are probably thousands of people around the world right now. Cutting your finger while I'm finisheding this sentence.

conversation.input: where are some common places where people can encounter lots of dangerous items?
conversation.output: Well, aside from the kitchen, at home, construction sites come to mind like where a new building is being put up. There are many types of heavy machinery which can be quite dangerous if people aren't careful.

conversation.input: How has technological advancements reduced the danger of certain tools?
conversation.output: New innovations have made a lot of equipment much safer than in the past. New types of sensors and materials reduce the likelihood of getting injured.

conversation.input: Can you give a couple examples of this?
conversation.output: Yes, like the chain so that I had talked about, it has a safety guard added to it and my uncle's table saw will turn off as soon as a person's hand is too close to it. Also, safety gear like helmets and clothes are much brighter and stronger than in the past.

conversation.input: Let's talk about user safety. What should people do before they use an object that is potentially dangerous?
conversation.output: It is very important that people read the safety instructions and user manuals before using an object that can be dangerous. Also, I think it is a good idea to watch some safety videos online and get the right training. I think it would be a really bad idea to start up a chain. So without knowing how to use it correctly.

conversation.input: why do some people not do this?
conversation.output: Well, I think it's mostly ignorance times people are in a rush and just want to get a job done so they do not pay attention to safety. This is usually when problems happen happen.

conversation.input: What kinds of objects are commonly found around the home that help people to avoid injuries?

conversation.input: Where should people store store objects like these?

conversation.input: Where do you like to sleep?

conversation.input: When do you go to bed and why?

conversation.input: What helps you to sleep better .

conversation.input: How do you feel when you do not get enough sleep?
conversation.output: Like most people, I feel quite grumpy when I'm low in sleep. I get cranky and I'm irritable. My attention span is low and I tend to snap at people, so it's definitely better, better for me to get a full nice rest.

conversation.input: Let's talk more about exercising the mind. What are different ways that people keep their minds in good health?
conversation.output: As I said, like chess, strategy games are a good way to keep the mind fit. Also, learning languages has been shown to be very good for long mental health. And I think that physical exercise is also very important. After all, the brain is a biological machine.

conversation.input: Which of these is the most effective?
conversation.output: That's a tough question because all of these are very important, but I suppose if I could choose only one, it would be physical exercise since an unhealthy body would definitely deteriorate the mind.

conversation.input: Some people believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind. Do you agree with this? Why or why not?
conversation.output: Yes, as I have just mentioned, this is very true, the brain requires a lot of blood and nutrients to function well. I've read that in certain situations like exams, the brain can use up about 60% of the metabolic energy produced by the body, which is incredible considering that it only makes up around 2% of our body weight.

conversation.input: Is this always true?
conversation.output: Yes, I think this will always hold true. Like people who drink alcohol and use drugs all eventually feel the negative effects on their mind's function.

conversation.input: What improvements in the education system could improve the thinking of students?
conversation.output: I think that a greater emphasis on critical thinking instead of rote memory would be a big positive for school curricula.

conversation.input: Can you elaborate on that?
conversation.output: Certainly, I think that many school lessons still focus too much on memorizing historical and scientific facts, like the name of the third Prime Minister, rather than focusing on rational thinking, such as understanding the best way to evaluate the future of a stock price.

conversation.input: let's discuss effective, effective learning. One of the most important steps needed to make sure students learn effectively.
conversation.output: I think that systematic assessment and feedback are very important to optimize the learning of students.

conversation.input: Why are these so important?
conversation.output: These are important to keep track of students abilities and development, as well as to identify areas that need improvement.

conversation.input: Can you give an example of this?
conversation.output: Yes. While starting for IELTS, I did one full practice exam each week and I always spend a few hours identifying and learning from my mistakes. This way I learned that I need to pay attention to verb tense in my writing.

conversation.input: How has technology helped increase the efficiency of learning here?
conversation.output: There are a pleasure of ways that modern tech has improved learning. The internet has given a wealth of resources to both teachers and students, which simply wasn't nearly as accessible in the past.

conversation.input: Which kinds of technology will make a big difference in education and learning in the future?
conversation.output: I think that virtual reality and artificial intelligence will make a great impact on future learning. I think that this will allow students to be even more engaged with this subject and therefore gain more knowledge faster.

conversation.output: I think that a greater emphasis on critical thinking instead of rote memory would be a big positive for school curricula.

conversation.input: Can you elaborate on that?
conversation.output: Certainly, I think that many school lessons still focus too much on memorizing historical and scientific facts, like the name of the third Prime Minister, rather than focusing on rational thinking, such as understanding the best way to evaluate the future of a stock price.

conversation.input: let's discuss effective, effective learning. One of the most important steps needed to make sure students learn effectively.
conversation.output: I think that systematic assessment and feedback are very important to optimize the learning of students.

conversation.input: Why are these so important?
conversation.output: These are important to keep track of students abilities and development, as well as to identify areas that need improvement.

conversation.input: Can you give an example of this?

conversation.input: How has technology helped increase the efficiency of learning here?

conversation.input: Which kinds of technology will make a big difference in education and learning in the future?
conversation.output: I think that virtual reality and artificial intelligence will make a great impact on future learning. I think that this will allow students to be even more engaged with this subject and therefore gain more knowledge faster.

conversation.input: Do you have a favorite flower?

conversation.input: What kinds of animals do you usually see?
conversation.output: I usually see house pets, like cats and dogs around my neighborhood. But I also see, crows and finches and at a certain time, time of a year.

conversation.input: where can you go to see animals?
conversation.output: The city zoo is a fantastic place to see animals. I absolutely love to go there to see pandas. Aside from that, there are also a lot of pet shop around the city where I can see various kinds of little creatures, like goldfish and guinea pigs, hamster, parrots and rabbits.

conversation.input: Where can you go to see plants, plants and trees?
conversation.output: There is a national park not too far from my place, about 30 minutes drive. I like to go there, to see some greenery. And then, to see those beautiful plants, especially when I'm feeling a bit stressed. It is a good place, to go to relax, and then, to get some fresh air.

conversation.input: Have you ever been lost in a forest?
conversation.output: Luckily, no. I've never been lost in a forest. But I have heard it is a terrible feeling, to be turned around in the forest and it's really easy to get panic. In fact, whenever I go on hikes, or out into nature, I like to make sure, where I come from and then which directions I'm going.

conversation.input: If you could go to see plants and animals anywhere in the world, where would you go?
conversation.output: The, that's a bit tough question to answer because, there are obviously many beautiful places in the world. But if I can really go anywhere, I would likely to pick, central America, like Costa Rica, where there is, jungle, full of, colorful plants, birds and unique animals like toucan and sloth.

conversation.output: Perhaps the most pressure I have ever felt till this day and is sitting the Chinese standardized academic proficiency exam known as Gao Kao and I set this exam about two years ago in June. Gaokao is a national entrance exam every, Chinese high school graduate take in order to, test their skills and knowledge, for higher level education as well as their eligibility and for a certain, universities, this is a 9 hours exam, which takes place in 2 days, covering four subjects. And it is fear by most students. In fact, I have been preparing for this exam, since junior high school. Needless to say, I had a lot of pressure and anxiety and building up over this year leading to the exam. Not only myself, but also my parents were pushing really hard on me to do well in this exam because getting a great score will mean the possibility to enter a prestigious university and as well as, be on the path for an outstanding career. I had wanted to study electronics engineering and packing university and this meant I would have to score the top five percentile in this exam in order to manage such insane pressure. I exercise every day. One hour I'm doing yoga and swimming. I pay attention to both my mind and body. Also I invested hundreds, if not thousands of hours to prepare study effectively. I kept in my mind that, if, no matter what the outcome is, I have done my best and this is all I could ask of myself during the exam. I tried my best to stay focused, follow the strategy I prepare and, take, and pay attention, to my breathing. In the end, I have completed the exam better than I expected, and now I'm pursuing my goal in electronics engineering.

conversation.input: That's your time right there. I'm gonna stop you and, now we'll continue with part 3. I'm going to just take back this card. Can you please put the note paper to the side? conversation.output: Well, they were aesthetic. Like my mom, she couldn't stop smiling whole day and my dad just kept hugging me and told me how proud he was.

conversation.input: What was the most challenging part of the test?
conversation.output: I think the mathematical questions were kind of tough. I remember there were a couple of them, that I couldn't manage to solve it.

conversation.input: Let's talk about challenging moments in life. What are some typical situations when individuals feel a lot of pressure?
conversation.output: Aside from, the situation like this health exam, or the gaoko as I mentioned earlier, people also feel a lot of anxiety and performing in front of a crowd, like public speaking as well as peer pressure. When friends are challenging them to take risk, like when my friends challenge me to go bungee jumping with them.

conversation.input: what are good ways to cope with this kind of stress?
conversation.output: As I mentioned in the previous part and being strong in body and mind as well as staying focus at the task in hand are good ways to cope .

conversation.input: if people run away from difficult situations in life, what may be the consequences?
conversation.output: There are some dire repercussions to avoiding challenging situation in life. 1 may lack of, achievements, and then that could lead to self losing. I think life is full of challenges and people must take risk, in order to gain rewards.

conversation.input: How can people prepare themselves for challenging parts of life?
conversation.output: I think individuals must be prepared for demanding times in life, by assessing the situation, making plans as well as alternative plans in order to stay dynamic.

conversation.input: Can you elaborate? Yes.
conversation.output: absolutely. When I made my plan, for gaokao, I was prepared that, if I couldn't get the results to enter Peking University, alternatively, I would go to a different university abroad.

conversation.input: Let's talk about managing stress. Why is it important to manage stress?
conversation.output: It's absolutely necessary to handle the anxiety under a certain level, because, it is really damaging, body and mind. It is commonly said that, stress is the number one killer for humans, it could lead to heart attack and all kinds of psychological disorders.

conversation.input: What are some effective ways of handling stressful situations?
conversation.output: I think meditation, or breathing techniques like Tai chi as well as regular exercise are good ways to handle stress. Stress.
